snippet: The secretary of state on Tuesday said for the first time, “We are sorry” for the deaths of Pakistani soldiers in November airstrikes.
abstract: Pakistan will reopen NATO supply routes into neighboring Afghanistan following apology from Sec of State Hillary Rodham Clinton over the deaths of two dozen Pakistani soldiers in American airstrikes in November; agreement ends a bitter seven-month stalemate that came at a steep logistical and financial cost to United States interests.

byline.contributor: Salman Masood contributed reporting from Islamabad, Pakistan, and Matthew Rosenberg from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The secretary of state on Tuesday said for the first time, “We are sorry” for the deaths of Pakistani soldiers in November airstrikes.

headline.main: Clinton’s ‘Sorry’ to Pakistan Ends Barrier to NATO
headline.print_headline: Clinton’s ‘Sorry’ To Pakistan Ends Barrier To NATO
